member.summary: Query parameters/Search filters for Patient

member.summary: Family name e.g. Johnson.

member.summary: Business Identifier (not the same as logical id set by FHIR server internally)

member.summary: Query parameters/Search filters for Immunization

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ImmunizationQueryParameters.patient
member.summary: Reference to the patient.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ImmunizationQueryParameters.date
member.summary: Date that can be parsed. If this cannot be parsed successfully, it won't be used in query.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ImmunizationQueryParameters.identifier
member.summary: Business Identifier (not the same as logical id set by FHIR server internally)

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ImmunizationQueryParameters.id
member.summary: Logical id set by FHIR server internally

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.ObservationQueryParameters
member.summary: Query parameters/Search filters for Observation

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ObservationQueryParameters.subject
member.summary: Subject of the observation (e.g. patient)

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ObservationQueryParameters.category
member.summary: The classification of the type of observation laboratory, vital-signs or social-history.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ObservationQueryParameters.date
member.summary: Obtained datetime. If the obtained element is a date range, a date that falls in the range.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ObservationQueryParameters.identifier
member.summary: Business Identifier (not the same as logical id set by FHIR server internally)

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.ObservationQueryParameters.id
member.summary: Logical id set by FHIR server internally

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Practitioner
member.summary: FHIR Practitioner resource. A practitioner is someone who practices medicine for treating patients. They can be general medicine practitioners or specialists in some healthcare discipline.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Immunization
member.summary: Immunization resource is intended to cover the recording of current and historical administration of vaccines to patients.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Observation
member.summary: As per HL7 org, Observations are central elements in healthcare. They are used to support diagnosis, monitor progress, determine baselines and patterns and even capture demographic characteristics. Most observations are simple name/value pair assertions with some metadata, but some observations group other observations together logically, or even are multi-component observations.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Quantity
member.summary: Indicates values with quantity, unit for vital signs etc.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Patient
member.summary: FHIR Patient class.

member.name: T:Common.IPatientRepository
member.summary: Simple CRUD operations.

member.name: T:Common.PatientDto
member.summary: Dto class for Patient entity. Never use EF Core entities directly in BLL or DAL.
